citeinfo.origin: National Park Service, Salinas Pueblo Missions National Monument
citeinfo.title: Salinas Pueblo Missions National Monument Vegetation Mapping Project - Park Boundary
citeinfo.othercit: For details see Muldavin, E., P. Neville, T. Neville, T. Shulz, and A. Kennedy. 2010. The vegetation classification and map: Salinas Pueblo Missions National Monument, Natural Resources Technical Report NPS/SCPN/NRTR-2012/553.

descript.abstract: Boundary file used for the Gran Quivira, Quarai and Abo units of Salinas Pueblo Missions National Monument, New Mexico.
descript.purpose: Provide a working boundary for the Gran Quivira, Quarai and Abo units of Salinas Pueblo Missions National Monument, New Mexico. The Gran Quivira and Quarai units boundaries were digitized based on USGS DRG's and natural color 2005 DOQQ imagery. The coordinates for Abo Unit of Salinas Pueblo Missions National Monument, New Mexico were collected using a Trimble GeoExplorer GPS receiver. Points were collected along the fence boundary from which a line coverage was created by on-screen digitzing in ArcView. Metadata for the data layer containing these data points can be found within the SAPU metadata collection. Refer to file name, sapu_abo_fence_points.txt. It should be noted that this data layer is an approximation of the actual location of the park unit boundary and not to be used for any purpose other than which it was intended. Please read the Distribution Liability contained in this metadata. The intended use of all data in a park's GIS library is to support diverse park activities including planning, management, maintenance, research, and interpretation.
descript.supplinf: For details see Muldavin, E., P. Neville, T. Neville, T. Shulz, and A. Kennedy. 2010. The vegetation classification and map: Salinas Pueblo Missions National Monument, Natural Resources Technical Report NPS/SCPN/NRTR-2012/553. The shapefile was imported into a geodatabase by the USGS/CSS/Core Science Analytics and Synthesis.

attracc.attraccr: Data collection was stream-lined through use of a data dictionary attribute menu installed in the GPS data logger. This procedure enhances attribute accuracy by reducing attribute related decision-making in the field and minimizing keying errors.

citeinfo.origin: Intermountain GIS Center, Albuquerque, New Mexico
citeinfo.title: Global Positioning System (GPS)
citeinfo.othercit: GPS data collection conducted on-site at Salinas Pueblo Missions NM. Data processing at the IMR GIS Center.

procstep.procdesc: GPS files were differentially corrected using base station data from the NMERI site in Albuquerque, New Mexico. The GPS processing software was Trimble Pathfinder Office Version 2.5.1
A point theme was added to a data dictionary attribute menu for use in the GPS data logger.
In Arc View, graphic lines were drawn connecting the fence points and then converted into a shapfile to create the boundary coverage.

cntaddr.address: Bandelier West Room 111, University of New Mexico

procstep.procdesc: GPS based coordinates were collected at Abo on 6/21/01.
The corrected GPS files were then exported to ESRI ArcView 3.2 shapefile format.
The Shapefile was imported into a geodatabase by the USGS/CSS/Core Science Analytics and Synthesis.

distinfo.distliab:
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics (if available) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such.
The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. Any related graphics (if available) are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not approriate to use the related graphics as data.
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an U.S. Geological Survey and National Park Service servers and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. Mention of trade names or commercial products in this metadata report does not constitute endorsement or recommendation for use by the U. S. Department of the Interior, U. S. Geological Survey and National Park Service.
